etymology.description: 注(注) (zhù, "concentrate; pour") + 意(意) (yì, "meaning; idea") = concentrate one's meaning -> to pay attention
etymology.interpretation: In Chinese, 注(注) (zhù, "concentrate; pour") suggests focusing or directing one's mental energy, while 意(意) (yì, "meaning; idea") refers to one's mind or thoughts. Together, 注意(注意) (zhùyì, "pay attention") means to concentrate one's thoughts or mind on a particular subject, implying careful consideration or focus.

examples.chinese: 我没有注意(我沒有注意)，窗外下雪了(窗外下雪了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ méiyǒu zhùyì, chuāngwài xiàxuě le.
examples.english: I didn't pay attention, and it started snowing outside.

examples.chinese: 写作时请注意语法(寫作時請注意語法)，会让表达更清楚(會讓表達更清楚)。
examples.pinyin: Xiězuò shí qǐng zhùyì yǔfǎ, huì ràng biǎodá gèng qīngxī.
examples.english: Please pay attention to grammar when writing; it will make your expression clearer.

examples.chinese: 上课时注意听(上課時注意聽)，注意看黑板(注意看黑板)。
examples.pinyin: Shàngkè shí zhùyì tīng, zhùyì kàn hēibǎn.
examples.english: During class, pay attention to listening and look at the blackboard.
